intro: Adinandra lancipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adinandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Adinandra lancipetala is often found in secondary forests and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
